intro: Euphrasia picta, commonly known as the painted eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia picta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
